page.title: 06R.A.F. MOUNTBATTEN
page.content: The{R.A.F.}has occupied Mountbatten for over sixty years. During this time it has served as a base for flying boats and{air-sea rescue. }Now in 1985 there are 350 men and women working there either in the{weather station}or in the school of{survival and combat {training.}They do not have a VSTOL runway any more although{helicopters do sometimes land there. All{air crew,}no matter which aircraft they fly, are trained to know what to do if they crash in enemy territory.They are taught to survive on water and land and to evade the enemy.{Fighter pilots,}who need a minimum of five O levels to begin their three year training, carry Â£6000 worth of equipment with them on operations. R.A.F. Mountbatten is due to{close}in the near future.
